instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
This board had a lot of water damage in the area of the cpu/gpu. The fans would spin and the heatsink would get slightly warm. While the liquid damage was still there I measured <SIGNAL>PPCPU_S0VCORE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> and I got 0.83v on cpuvcore and I believe I had around 0.9v on gpuvcore(I am not 100% sure about gpu vcore).
I removed the taped cover that is above the heatsink area and there was bad liquid damage under there. I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7469</RESISTOR> since they looked bad. I put flux and heated the rest of the areas that looked damaged then UC'd the board.

The fans still spin now but now I dont feel the heatsink getting warm. I have around 0.82v on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> but 0v on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> also has 0v
Pin 1 of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is 0v even with display cable plugged in.

I'm not sure if any of those components I replaced caused this.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - stable 12.6v
PPVIN S5 HS COMPUTING ISNS - 12.6v

Here were the areas I marked that had liquid damage before cleaning them.

<CAPACITOR>C8928</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8923</CAPACITOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>
j5815
<CHIP>U5860</CHIP>
j4410
<CAPACITOR>C9820</CAPACITOR>
<CHIP>U7541</CHIP>
<CAPACITOR>C7576</CAPACITOR> and caps next to

I did these measurements with no external components plugged in and with a genuine 85w charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: Corrosion on MUX, the enable signals for both rails came from MUX and they are one next to other.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: Voltage present on L8360?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  L8360 has 0v on both sides. There was 5v on Pin 19 of <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> but I got 0v on Pin 15.

[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER]  I'm not familiar with the MUX. Which component would that be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> MUX. Don't reflow just some flux and heat.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9100</CHIP> had no signs of liquid damage near it. All the probe points around it were all gold. 

I still fluxed and heated <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> but I still have no gpu vcore or anything on L8360.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> is the first GPU rail that should come on. Check if it pulses maybe once after power on. Did you check for shorts on any GPU rails?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
I checked for <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> on L8604. As soon as the charger was plugged in it would show around 1.4v and quickly go down towards 0v.

In diode mode on Pin 1 of L8604 I got 0.46v so that doesn't look like a short.

Could any of this been caused when I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>? It's difficult to see if it's correctly in place since it has a cover on it. I also had to use a lot of hot air to get them off so hopefully I didn't kill the cpu/gpu.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: What about short on other GPU rails? Core, FB?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
I checked GPU Vcore on <CAPACITOR>C8962</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C8961</CAPACITOR> in diode mode and I got 0.04v.
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_GPU_FB</SIGNAL> (Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R8305</RESISTOR>) in diode mode shows 0.48v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> would be the only suspect if we are just looking at the parts you replaced.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
Okay I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> one by one and turned it on.
There was still no Gpu vcore after replacing the first two mosfets but after I replaced the last one(<TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>) the fans will spin for a couple of seconds then turn off and it keeps doing the cycle over and over.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: No idea, is there even CPU Vcore now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: Cpu vcore comes on for the first second of the fan turning on and off at 1.11v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: GPU core also pulsing now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
Gpu vcore only pulsed to about 0.1v

In diode mode cpu vcore is reading 0.002v and gpu vcore is 0.034
Is that a short on cpu vcore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: Nah, that is probably ok. I really have no ideas for this one, but to check all your work and inspect for corroded traces/resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message:
Okay so I replaced some caps that looked bad. First was <CAPACITOR>C7121</CAPACITOR>. Still didn't make a change. 
<CAPACITOR>C8923</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C8928</CAPACITOR> looked really bad so I removed them and there was no pad on the Pin 1 side. I plugged in the charger again and measured for <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and It showed 12.6v.
I added solder and scraped both sides and I could see some of the black coating of the board coming off of the ground pads. I had to run a wire from <CAPACITOR>C8923</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C8928</CAPACITOR> to Pin 7 of <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>. 

I plugged the charger in and now the fans weren't spinning at all and <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> was 1.4v and in diode mode it was 0.035v to ground
I'm not sure if the black enamel coating that scraped from the board is causing the short.

I injected around 2v into Pin 7 of <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>(<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL>) and the only thing getting warm was the <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> Nvidia chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: That would mean <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> is shorted. Either it was soldered bad or <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> is dead. Both should be changed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gpu vcore and nothing on screen
threads.message: I replaced both and it is still turning on and off. I will be sending this back. Thanks for the help.
